lines: As you can see, #p, my feet ache from this heavy load. Care you to buy something?
We Dwarves do not usually trade with Men, but you are an exception, #p.
Ale, armour, weapons - you want it, it's yours, my friend! As long as you have enough coins...
I come from the mighty strongholds of the Blue Mountains, #p. No other Dwarves boast riches quite like ours.
I am travelling the land in search of wealth - perhaps you are doing the same, #p?
Give me some coins, #p, and I shall be a very happy merchant indeed!
Greetings, #p! Do you wish to buy some goods from me?
I bring great treasures from the Blue Mountains! You can have them... for a certain price!
Do you wish to trade with me, #p? I have several items which might be of interest to you.
I will sell you anything for a fair price!
Do you want to trade with me, #p? For a few dozen silver coins you can enjoy the craftwork of the Dwarves of Ered Luin!
Don't expect to get the better of me, you rowdy lad!
You are no match for the kinsmen of the Blue Mountains!
You should not have come here, #p!
I'll cleave your miserable skull in twain!
Come on, lad! Show me what you've got!
Suffer the wrath of the Dwarves, #p!
Came you here only to be crushed?
Out with you, Morgul-scum!
Draw your last breath, #p!
No Dwarven ale for you!
Raaarrrgh!
I'll crush you like a rock, lad!
You have underestimated us, #p!
You're a nasty piece of work, #p!
What were you thinking, picking a fight with me? Ha!
Woe and ruin upon you and your kin, #p!
Khazâd ai-mênu!
Ishkhaqwi ai durugnul!
May you die in dragon-fire!
How dare you enter our lands?
Begone, Orc-scum!
You will pay for trespassing here, Morgul-scum!
